feature.name: Ranger Archetype: Arcane Guardian (HB)
feature.text:
Arcane spellcasters are known to inspire fear with their formidable and unpredictable magic, but some rangers have taken up the mantle of Arcane Guardians to counter this threat. Trained by prestigious noble houses, arcane schools, or remote temples, these elite warriors are experts in suppressing and punishing the misuse of magic and eliminating magical creatures that wreak havoc on the lives of the common folk. Arcane Guardians are not your typical rangers. They possess knowledge of both wizard spells and ranger spells, granting them a powerful advantage in combating magical dangers. They have honed their skills in magic manipulation and resistance, and have learned to draw upon their inner reserves to unleash spells that surpass their normal capabilities. Their weapons are imbued with mystical energy that disrupts the magic of their foes, causing immense pain with each strike. Many Arcane Guardians are created through alchemical processes or magic rituals, either voluntarily to protect their people or through forced experimentation. Regardless of their origin, they possess a versatility that sets them apart from other rangers, including access to more aggressive spells. Whether hunting specific creatures or patrolling as protectors against megalomaniacal spellcasters and dangerous magical artifacts, Arcane Guardians are always ready to face the unknown and defend the innocent from the perils of magic. These fearless warriors embody the true spirit of a ranger, fearlessly facing danger and steadfastly defending civilization.
Arcane Guardian in Tanares: In Tanares, magic is as revered as it is feared. It has brought both marvels and disasters, such as the downfall of the once-prosperous Mystical Kingdom, which was destroyed by a Malrokian Curse. Society's fear of magic and mages led Emperor Baleroth to dedicate resources towards controlling and restricting the use of arcane powers. To protect the Tanarean Empire from magical threats, special groups were created to study and combat arcane magic. These Arcane Guardians underwent rigorous training and mystical experiments to hone their sensitivity to magical energies and track them. Many of them harbor a deep-seated hatred for the indiscriminate use of magic, either due to the Empire's manipulative training or because of the atrocities they suffered during their training. Regardless of their motivations, they treat magic users with suspicion and instability. Over time, some of these soldiers discovered that not all of the targets they hunted were truly dangerous conjurers. Many were merely political pawns, leading some Guardians to question their orders and seek a way out of the Imperial forces. Those who managed to desert and survive became mercenaries, adventurers, or reclusive hermits, always evading the reach of the Empire's agents. With the formation of the Magocracy of Mage Tower, many of these previously hidden rangers were invited to join a special force of arcane combatants, serving as part of the Magocracy's guard and army. Others took advantage of the Empire's diminished influence to live freely in the Republic or other nations beyond its reach.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 242 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Arcane Education (Arcane Guardian (HB))
feature.text:
At 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the Arcana skill and learn two wizard cantrips of your choice. Additionally, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks when tracking creatures of a magical nature or those that possess any form of spellcasting, at the GM's discretion.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 243 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Arcane Guardian Magic (Arcane Guardian (HB))
feature.text:
At 3rd level, you expand your magical knowledge. Whenever you learn a new ranger spell, you can choose it from the wizard spell list in addition to the ranger spell list. Also at 3rd level, you learn two additional spells of your choice from the wizard spell list. These spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. They do not count towards the number of ranger spells you know. Each time you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these extra spells with another from the wizard spell list, as long as you have spell slots for the new spell's level.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 243 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Arcane Predator (Arcane Guardian (HB))
feature.text:
At 3rd level, you learn to channel your arcane energy into your strikes. The first time you hit an undead, an aberration, or a creature that has some form of spellcasting with a weapon attack each turn, you deal an extra 1d8 force damage. At 11th level, this additional damage increases to 1d10.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 243 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Guardian Meditation (Arcane Guardian (HB))
feature.text:
Starting at 7th level, you can regain some of your magical energy by sitting in meditation and communing with nature. During a short rest, you choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than your proficiency bonus, and you can divide this recovery between multiple short rests. Once you reach the recovery limit, you can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest. For example, if your proficiency bonus is +3, you could recover three 1st-level spell slots, one 1st-level and one 2nd-level spell slot, or one 3rd-level spell slot. Then, you need to finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 243 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Arcane Rebuke (Arcane Guardian (HB))
feature.text:
At 11th level, you gain advantage on saving throws against spells. Additionally, when a creature within 60 feet of you casts a spell that targets you and you succeed on the saving throw, you can reflect a portion of the spell's energy back at the caster. This reflected energy deals 1d6 force damage per level of the spell to the caster.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 243 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Arcane Secret of the Guardian (Arcane Guardian (HB))
feature.text:
At 15th level, your mastery of the arcane reaches new heights. You learn one 7th-level spell from the wizard spell list, which you can cast without needing any material components. Once you cast this spell, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 243 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Ranger Archetype: Shadow Investigator (HB)
feature.text:
The rapid spread of the penumbral threat has caused widespread fear and unease in populated areas, particularly in urban centers where these creatures can more easily blend in and corrupt individuals. In response, the Shadow Investigator has emerged, possessing the skills and intuition necessary to swiftly detect and eliminate these malevolent beings. Through their extensive network of connections and their keen senses, the Shadow Investigator gathers information, analyzes affected locations, and identifies their targets with precision. Their mastery of the enemy and their tactics, honed through extensive training in fighting the penumbral threat, allows for efficient and effective operations. Whether it's hunting down penumbral creatures or targeting sinister cultists, the Shadow Investigator is determined to root out evil at its source. Despite their unconventional methods, the Shadow Investigator remains a critical component in the ongoing struggle against the penumbral menace. They keep their knowledge close to the vest, sharing it only with trusted pupils or assistants, but their mastery of the enemy and their tactics make them an indispensable force in the fight. Though their methods may engender distrust or fear among the general population, the Shadow Investigator is a necessary presence in the ongoing battle against the penumbral threat.
In Other Settings: The Shadow Investigator subclass can be an excellent addition to any setting, providing a great asset to any group with their skills in detecting and eliminating malevolent creatures or individuals. Although the Shadow Investigator's skills were honed for detecting and fighting penumbral creatures in Tanares, they can be adapted to track and eliminate any creature that threatens the safety of a town or city. Their unorthodox methods and social outcast status may cause distrust or fear among the population, but their dedication to rooting out evil at its source is paramount to keeping people safe. Whether in a high-fantasy or low-fantasy setting, Shadow Investigators can be employed to track and eliminate a wide range of creatures. For example, in a high-fantasy setting, they could track and eliminate evil wizards and magical creatures, while in a low-fantasy setting, they could hunt down thieves and other criminals that threaten the safety of a town or city. Shadow Investigators can be changed to be trained to track any creature that permeates human society and stalks the night, such as vampires, ghouls, doppelgangers, demons, and devils. The Shadow Investigator is a social outcast detective or monster hunter that walks in the shadows to track and remove the evil creatures that stalk at night. Players should discuss with their GM the most interesting creature types to track and eliminate for their campaign. With their unique set of skills and abilities, Shadow Investigators are an adaptable subclass that can be integrated into any campaign.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 238 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Shadow Investigator Magic (Shadow Investigator (HB))
feature.text:
Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Shadow Investigator Spells table. This spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.
Shadow Investigator Spells: Ranger Level | Spells 3rd | disguise self 5th | zone of truth 9th | speak with dead 13th | arcane eye 17th | legend lore
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 239 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Shadow Investigator Intuition (Shadow Investigator (HB))
feature.text:
At 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the Insight skill. If you're already proficient in it, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. Moreover, whenever you make a Charisma (Deception) or Intelligence (Investigation) check, you can use your Wisdom modifier instead of your Charisma or Intelligence modifier.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 239 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Combat Instinct (Shadow Investigator (HB))
feature.text:
Starting at 3rd level, you can analyze an enemy's movements, giving you a unique advantage. As a bonus action, you can choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of you as your focus and select one of the following benefits:
Find the Opening. Whenever you make an attack roll against your focus, you roll an extra 1d6 and add it to the result. This bonus increases to 1d8 if your focus is an aberration or a creature from the Penumbral Plane.
Dodge. You gain a +3 bonus to your Armor Class against attacks from your focus. Additionally, when making a saving throw against an effect caused by your focus, roll an extra 1d6 and add it to the result. This die increases to 1d8 if your target is an aberration or a creature from the Penumbral Plane. This chosen benefit lasts until you finish a short or long rest, designate a new focus, or select a different benefit using this feature again.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 239 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Detective's Cunning (Shadow Investigator (HB))
feature.text:
At 7th level, your intuition sharpens. You can't be surprised while you are conscious, and you gain advantage on saving throws against illusion and enchantment spells. Furthermore, you instantly notice when a creature within 20 feet of you alters or conceals its true form through disguise, magic, or other means. You can tell that the creature is disguising or hiding its true form, but you don't learn its true form.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 240 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Quick Witted (Shadow Investigator (HB))
feature.text:
At 11th level, your swift adaptability allows you to quickly formulate plans against your foes. Whenever you use the Combat Instinct feature, you can also perform one of the following as part of the same bonus action:
Cunning Step. You can move up to 5 feet. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.
Exploit Weakness. The next successful attack you make against your focus this turn deals an extra 1d6 damage. This damage increases to 1d8 if your target is an aberration or a creature from the Penumbral Plane.
Quick Thinking. You can take the Use an Object action.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 240 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Shadow Hunter (Shadow Investigator (HB))
feature.text:
At 15th level, you become a true scourge to aberrations and creatures from the Penumbral Plane. You gain advantage on Intelligence (Investigation), Wisdom (Insight), and Wisdom (Perception) checks related to aberrations and creatures from the Penumbral Plane. In addition, you have advantage on attack rolls against these creatures and on saving throws against effects created by them.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 240 (Homebrew)
